feed.title: Julian Dolby, IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center
feed.subtitle: Presentations

entry.title: Toward Scalable Semantic Big Data
entry.content:
Toward Scalable Semantic Big Data




Julian Dolby

IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center





Semantic Big Data, SIGMOD, Chicago, May 2017

Example OWL Universe

  • Individuals
    $\begin{array}{l}Museum(Athens), Museum(Heraklion)\\ Minoan(LaParisienne), Mycenean(DeathMask)\end{array}$
  • Roles
    $\begin{array}{l} Exhibits(Athens,DeathMask)\\ Exhibits(Heraklion,LaParisienne) \end{array}$
  • Axioms
    $\begin{array}{l} Minoan \sqsubseteq \exists{creationSite.Crete}\\ Mycenaean \sqsubseteq \exists{creationSite.Mycenae} \end{array}$

Example ABox $A$

The Summary ABox

  • Map ABox $A$ to $A'$ for scalability using $f$
    $\begin{array}{l} C(a) \in A \implies C(f(a)) \in A'\\ R(a,b) \in A \implies R(f(a), f(b)) \in A' \end{array}$
  • We choose concept sets as f

Example Summary ABox $A'$

Example Query

  • "Museums that have works from Crete"
  • Answer is Heraklion since has Minoan LaParisienne
  • DL: $Museum \wedge \exists{Exhibits.\exists{creationSite.Crete}}$
  • Needs DL reasoning: creationSite edge is implicit
Artwork creationSite category Museum long lat ip-api.com some random math, like $\theta$
entry.summary: Toward Scalable Semantic Big Data Julian Dolby IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center Semantic Big Data, SIGMOD, Chicago, May 2017

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
Toward Scalable Semantic Big Data

You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
